segments.text: What's up, everybody?
Welcome back to the formula America podcast where your host curtain Dylan and we are going to attempt to unpack whatever happened this weekend.
This was one of those wild weekends all throughout.
Absolutely wild.
I don't even.
From start to finish mistakes, I am stupid.
The works.
Yeah.
It was, I don't recall another qualifying session quite like this one.
For one, it took forever.
It was like two hours long.
It set the record for the most red flags in any qualifying session.
It was crazy.
It was like, as soon as it got going again, red flag and you're like, Oh my.
God, just get it together.
And it wasn't even raining really.
No.
And then it was kind of funny, like Q2.
Max was still in the pits when everybody was going out in the beginning of it.
And everyone was like, why is he still?
Has he noticed all the red flags going out?
You should probably go set a time, actually.
Like.
Yeah, I remember looking at that his car didn't even have wheels.
Yeah.
But.
All right.

Yep.
Hulkenberg crashed.
I think he, did he ever come back?

I am stupid.

a rare mistake by the Australian.

one, right?

Very exciting.

four and a half tenths of a second.

I.

on a track that has been sitting, getting sprinkled on for a little bit during the red flag, or you run the risk of putting him out behind people.
